"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542c5b5c636872781b950100#post_542c5b5c636872781b950100

Well, technically, NASA hasn't confirmed its addition to the planet lineup yet, but they've discovered five of its moons. So naturally, debate is going wild. 

Also, it's apparently bigger than Eris, which is another planet very far (an understatement, really) from the sun. Which also points to it actually being a planet.
